revised_title: Classification and Properties of Galactic X-ray Sources
tldr: The article reviews the current status of galactic X-ray sources and presents a tentative classification scheme based on the nature of their optical counterparts. It discusses high-mass and low-mass binary systems, their properties, and differences in X-ray behavior. The article also highlights recent observations of three galactic X-ray sources, H1705-25, and SS Cygni, and their implications for understanding the nature of these sources.
